lexUnit.name: follow.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: act according to (an instruction or precept)

sentence.text: He denied that guidelines were not followed .
` But even for our humble purse there are some simple guidelines to follow . "
So now the Commission and other countryside conservation groups , have produced a series of guidelines for the private landowners to follow .

Last year , FIMBRA , along with the life-assurance watchdog , LAUTRO , issued detailed mandatory guidelines to be followed by their members before advising members of occupational pension schemes to transfer into private personal pension plans .
If these rules were followed , then all cares and troubles vanished ; as we say in Scotland , like snow off a dyke .
To put this another way , we can predict what is going to happen in most of the situations in which we find ourselves because we have expectations that certain rules will be followed .
I have dome as a Hahnemann requested and have followed his instructions exactly .
You do n't need to follow the instructions rigidly .
The clerk did not follow the instructions given by Mr. Tucker 's memorandum .
Following his instruction , his party hastened to the windows .
Ask yourself and your colleagues why you follow the laws of society .
` Follow the laws of the game ! " he said , eagerly preparing himself for our fight .

So far as agriculture is concerned , the production group enables farmers to follow the principles of land consolidation and farm modernisation without the otherwise inevitable forcible retirement or migration .
Following the rules of classical dance
When drawing a line by eye , many people seem to try to follow rule 1 or rule 2 .
The decision followed a European Court of Justice ruling that Britain 's ban on Sunday opening does not breach EC statutes .
He could think he was following the rule , when he was in fact not doing so ; the new sensation could seem to resemble the original one , when it does not resemble it in fact .
If we follow this rule , most problems disappear .
It was a pity one could not invade without giving advance warnings and following the rules : it would be a pushover .
In the case of changes proposed by a member of the Computer Group , the procedures to be followed vary according to the stage of development at which the change is identified .
